unreliability_text: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
Compare.graph_title: Trends in Carbon Monoxide Hospitalizations - Fire-Related - Age-Adjusted Rate 2000 to 2013

info.info_how_calculated: NYC resident hospitalizations containing ICD-9 diagnosis code for carbon monoxide poisoning, 986, or any of the following: E868.2, E868.3, E868.8, E868.9. Must also have an unintentional fire-related injury code within E890.0-E899.9. Cannot have any intentional injury code E950.0-E969. Counts are summed by 5-year age groups and divided by the population in each age group, using NYC DOHMH intercensal estimates; quotients are multiplied by the proportion of the 2000 US population in each age group. Age-adjusted rate is the sum of the weighted age-specific rates; expressed as cases per million residents.
info.info_source: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data
